comments: Andy doesn\'t explain thing well/at all. When doing problems on the board, he goes through it too fast and you\'re stuck reading his scribbles. Doesn\'t actually teach you- you pretty much teach yourself. Flexible with due dates & does give extra credit on HW assignments. Won\'t meet you to help you. Doesn\'t help when you ask for it. Don\'t take him!!

stu_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES  LOTS OF HOMEWORK  SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.
comments: I took this course to fulfill a grad school prerequisite. I\'ve never had a teacher so disorganized in my academic career. Deadlines he posted were for the previous semester. He randomly changed assignment/quiz due dates. Goes off on non-accounting tangents and hurries lecture. You\'re better off teaching yourself accounting than taking his course.

tag_professor: LOTS OF HOMEWORK (8)  Tough Grader (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (3)  Participation matters (2)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Caring (1)
comments: I learned more about economics and smart cars than accounting from this teacher. He spent a lot of time rambling about things that had no relevance to the course. not very clear on how he wanted problems set up. very hard to follow. I would never take him for any class ever again.

stu_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK  SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.
comments: I do not recommend him. He knows a lot about his subject, but not his powerpoints or his exams. He is very relaxed and ambiguous about how you should complete problems, but then he grades you down for minute things he said were not a problem. He also says many things are not on the exam, but they are and he does not remember saying otherwise.

stu_tags: SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.  LOTS OF HOMEWORK  TOUGH GRADER
comments: Vranich is one of the worst teachers @ Butte. He is lazy (uses other teachers materials) and doesn\'t even know his own powerpoint presentations. Basically expect to show up and learn nothing, then go home and teach yourself. His military background shows in his hostile teaching style. Majority of prior students strongly dislike him.

stu_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK  CARING  GIVES GOOD FEEDBACK
comments: Andy is a great guy. Goes very fast through lectures so be prepared to stop him and ask questions when you need to otherwise you will get lost. Hes always willing to help if you need it. Be prepared for lots of homework. On average I spent 12-14 hours per week, but its needed to understand the material. All in all, pretty good teacher

tag_professor: LOTS OF HOMEWORK (8)  Tough Grader (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (3)  Participation matters (2)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Caring (1)
comments: He\'s really funny which is nice because the content of the class is pretty dry. He speaks quickly and his writing is pretty illegible, but he will spend as much time as needed to make sure everyone is caught up and understands. He is flexible with due dates and test dates because he wants everyone to do well. I recommend him as a teacher.

tag_professor: LOTS OF HOMEWORK (8)  Tough Grader (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (3)  Participation matters (2)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Caring (1)
comments: I enjoyed taking this class from Andy as he took the time to explain whatever problem the class might have. He made sure the class understood each chapter before going on because if you did not get you weren\'t going to. He does tell you when your homework is done and when the exams are. If you ask for help, he will make time to help you.

comments: I thought Andy is a teacher who wants you to get it. Nice guy, great teacher but a lot of homework. But to get the concept the homework is needed. I didn\'t know anything about accounting but now i feel comfortable and would gladly take another class with him homework and all

comments: Vranich is pretty unorganized. HW is only due when we go over it in class and nothing has a set due date. His lectures are boring, but if you just read the book and do the HW then you\'ll learn what you need. It\'s not a terrible class, but if you can find another ACCT20 class...I\'d recommend it.

tag_professor: LOTS OF HOMEWORK (8)  Tough Grader (3)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (3)  Participation matters (2)  EXTRA CREDIT (1)  BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES (1)  Gives good feedback (1)  Get ready to read (1)  Caring (1)
comments: Hard to follow sometimes; moves pretty fast. Questions encouraged. He wants you to get it. Generous with his time after class for questions. Quizzes weekly, but pretty basic. Attendance & completed homework are necessary to pass. He said the class would be down to 1/3 at the end; it was. A lot of homework, but basically a good class.

comments: These posts are wrong. Andy is so funny and makes accounting fun. He is very nice and stays after as long as needed to answer any questions.

comments: This guy\'s all over the place. Penmanship is total chicken scratch, he talks too fast and admits that he has some attention deficit issues. When I started the class we were at full capacity (40+ students) and at the end we had 13 students left. Quizzes weekly, which is ok, but he likes to make negative comments as he picks them up from your desk.
